profile.ja: 「極限状態における安定運転への挑戦」と銘打って、流体工学・流体機械の研究を行って参りました。特に、ポンプや水車など水力機械における性能向上と最適設計ならびに安定運転の諸問題解決に精力を傾けており、具体的には「小型高速ポンプにおけるキャビテーションによる不安定現象の解明」、「ゼロおよび超低落差水力の有効利用と水車開発」などがあります。流れや流体機械に関する運転技術や省エネルギー化、再生可能流体エネルギーに関するご相談ごとは喜んでお引受けします。

paper_title.ja: ポンプインデューサの入口上流に付設した軸対称障害板の脈動キャビテーション抑制効果
低比速度斜流ディフューザポンプに現れる不安定性能の解明（第１報，ディフューザ旋回失速挙動）
paper_title.en: Unstable Performance of a Low Specific Speed Mixed Flow Pump : 1st Report, a Diffuser Rotating Stall Behavior

description.ja: This paper treats the flow instabilities in a mixed flow pump with a vaned diffuser. Tested pump has a positive slope of the head-flow performance curve at about 65% flow rate of BEP (Best Efficiency Point). In order to investigate this phenomenon, pressure fluctuation measurements and dynamic PIV (Particle Image Velocimetry) measurements have been performed. As a result, it is found that unstable performance is caused by a rotating stall in the vaned diffuser. The flow from impeller exit is influenced on the large scaled backflow generated periodically from the vaned diffuser. Moreover, the backflow is induced by the strong vortex developed at the leading edge of diffuser vane. Based on PIV pictures, the relationship between the static pressure at the inlet of diffuser vane and the internal flow conditions is clarified.
description.en: This paper treats the flow instabilities in a mixed flow pump with a vaned diffuser. Tested pump has a positive slope of the head-flow performance curve at about 65% flow rate of BEP (Best Efficiency Point). In order to investigate this phenomenon, pressure fluctuation measurements and dynamic PIV (Particle Image Velocimetry) measurements have been performed. As a result, it is found that unstable performance is caused by a rotating stall in the vaned diffuser. The flow from impeller exit is influenced on the large scaled backflow generated periodically from the vaned diffuser. Moreover, the backflow is induced by the strong vortex developed at the leading edge of diffuser vane. Based on PIV pictures, the relationship between the static pressure at the inlet of diffuser vane and the internal flow conditions is clarified.

paper_title.en: Extra-Low Head Hydro and Tidal Power Generations with Darrieus-Type Water Turbine
Air-water two-phase characteristics of twin-screw pump and casing-wall pressure measurements

description.en: Pump characteristics of a twin-screw pump, which is positive displacement type, were investigated experimentally in water single-phase and air-water two-phase flow conditions. It is demonstrated that this type pump is able to operate even at high inlet void fraction of air in mixture more than 80 percents. In order to predict pumping flow rates under the various conditions of pressure differences between the inlet and outlet sections of twin-screw rotors, a simple model of gap flows between the rotor and the casing is proposed with an empirical relationship. The model is examined and discussed from the results of pressure measurements on casing wall and flow visualization of air behaviors in rotors.

paper_title.ja: ディフューザポンプ羽根車下流の流動様相(共著)

paper_title.en: Theoretical analysis of unsteady fluid forces working on inducer blades under rotating cavitation

description.en: Rotating cavitation is one of the flow instabilities associated with cavitation, which has been a severe problem for the development of turbopumps of liquid rocket engines because of causing the destructive super-synchronous shaft vibration. Recently, it is argued that rotating cavitation might also induce large repetitive stresses on blades in accordance with the unsteady pressure due to the significant change of cavitating regions. This paper describes about the theoretical prediction of unsteady blade forces working on the cavitating inducer under rotating cavitation. Unsteady pressure distributions and a lift force for a 2-dimensitional flat plate cascade under rotating cavitation are calculated by the linearized free streamline theory based on the unsteady closed cavity model and singularity method.
